node.Title: Career stories: Influencing engineering growth at LinkedIn
node.Description: Since learning frontend and backend skills, Rishika’s passion for engineering has expanded beyond her team at LinkedIn to grow into her own digital community. As she develops as an engineer, giving back has become the most rewarding part of her role. From intern to engineer—life at LinkedIn My career with LinkedIn began with a college internship, where I got to dive into all things engineering. Even as a summer intern, I absorbed so much about frontend and backend engineering during my time here. When I considered joining LinkedIn full-time after graduation, I thought back to the […]

node.Title: Tailor your Miro app to your users’ needs with custom actions
Data compliance in public sector: Making data secure and accessible isn’t mutually exclusive
Seamlessly correlate DBM and APM telemetry to understand end-to-end query performance
node.Description: When the services in your distributed application interact with a database, you need telemetry that gives you end-to-end visibility into query performance to troubleshoot application issues. But often there are obstacles: application developers don’t have visibility into the database or its infrastructure, and database administrators (DBAs) can’t attribute the database load to specific services.Now you can seamlessly link telemetry data from Database Monitoring (DBM) and Application Performance Monitoring (APM) to increase visibility and streamline troubleshooting.

node.Title: Elastic Security stops memory and kernel attacks in Round 5 of MITRE Engenuity Evaluations
New – Amazon EC2 M2 Pro Mac Instances Built on Apple Silicon M2 Pro Mac Mini Computers
node.Description: Today, we are announcing the general availability of Amazon EC2 M2 Pro Mac instances. These instances deliver up to 35 percent faster performance over the existing M1 Mac instances when building and testing applications for Apple platforms. New EC2 M2 Pro Mac instances are powered by Apple M2 Pro Mac Mini computers featuring 12 core […]

node.Title: New – NVMe Reservations for Amazon Elastic Block Store io2 Volumes
node.Description: Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) io2 and io2 Block Express volumes now support storage fencing using NVMe reservations. As I learned while writing this post, storage fencing is used to regulate access to storage for a compute or database cluster, ensuring that just one host in the cluster has permission to write to the […]

node.Title: Announcing the removal of bundled plugins in HashiCorp Packer
node.Description: As the final step in moving towards external plugins, HashiCorp Packer will stop bundling official plugins within its binary releases. Here’s what that means.

node.Title: Terraform Cloud now supports assigning agent pools at the organization level
node.Description: Assigning agents at the organization level provides a faster, more consistent, and scalable approach to agent pool configuration.

node.Title: Think Your Company Doesn’t Need a Chief Data Officer? Here Are 7 Reasons Why It Does
node.Description:
Perhaps your C-suite is already a bit crowded. The typical hierarchy will include a CEO, COO, CFO, CTO, CMO, CIO, and a few more. Adding another position may not be terribly appealing, but there is one C-suite role every company should consider—chief data and analytics officer (CDO or CDAO). The CDO is the point person […]

The post Think Your Company Doesn’t Need a Chief Data Officer? Here Are 7 Reasons Why It Does appeared first on Cloudera Blog.

node.Title: Leveling up Elastic Cloud security: Introduction to role-based access control
Elastic Stack 8.10.1 released
node.Description:
Version 8.10.1 of the Elastic Stack was released today. We recommend you upgrade to this latest version. We recommend 8.10.1 over the previous patch versions in 8.10.x.

The 8.10.1 patch release contains a fix for a potential security vulnerability. Please see our security advisory for more details.

For details of the issues that have been fixed and a full list of changes for each product in this version, please refer to the release notes.

node.Title: Making Content Security Policies (CSPs) easy with Page Shield
node.Description: We just deployed a number of updates to our Client-Side Security Product: Page Shield. As of today we support all major CSP directives, better suggestions, better violation reporting, Page Shield specific user role permissions, and domain insights
